tasks.help: Generate autocompletions script for Helm for the specified shell (bash or zsh). This command can generate shell autocompletions. e.g. 	$ helm completion bash Can be sourced as such 	$ source <(helm completion bash).

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for completion.

tasks.help: This command creates a chart directory along with the common files and directories used in a chart. For example, 'helm create foo' will create a directory structure that looks something like this: 	foo/ 	  | 	  |- .helmignore        # Contains patterns to ignore when packaging Helm charts. 	  | 	  |- Chart.yaml         # Information about your chart 	  | 	  |- values.yaml        # The default values for your templates 	  | 	  |- charts/            # Charts that this chart depends on 	  | 	  |- templates/         # The template files 	  | 	  |- templates/tests/   # The test files 'helm create' takes a path for an argument. If directories in the given path do not exist, Helm will attempt to create them as it goes. If the given destination exists and there are files in that directory, conflicting files will be overwritten, but other files will be left alone.

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for create.

properties.name: Starter
properties.help: The named Helm starter scaffold.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The name of chart directory to create.

tasks.help: This command takes a release name, and then deletes the release from Kubernetes. It removes all of the resources associated with the last release of the chart. Use the '--dry-run' flag to see which releases will be deleted without actually deleting them.

properties.name: Description
properties.help: Specify a description for the release.

properties.name: DryRun
properties.help: Simulate a delete.

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for delete.

properties.name: NoHooks
properties.help: Prevent hooks from running during deletion.

properties.name: Purge
properties.help: Remove the release from the store and make its name free for later use.

properties.name: Timeout
properties.help: Time in seconds to wait for any individual Kubernetes operation (like Jobs for hooks) (default 300).

properties.name: Tls
properties.help: Enable TLS for request.

properties.name: TlsCaCert
properties.help: Path to TLS CA certificate file (default "$HELM_HOME/ca.pem").

properties.name: TlsCert
properties.help: Path to TLS certificate file (default "$HELM_HOME/cert.pem").

properties.name: TlsHostname
properties.help: The server name used to verify the hostname on the returned certificates from the server.

properties.name: TlsKey
properties.help: Path to TLS key file (default "$HELM_HOME/key.pem").

properties.name: TlsVerify
properties.help: Enable TLS for request and verify remote.

properties.name: ReleaseNames
properties.help: The name of the releases to delete.

tasks.help: Build out the charts/ directory from the requirements.lock file. Build is used to reconstruct a chart's dependencies to the state specified in the lock file. This will not re-negotiate dependencies, as 'helm dependency update' does. If no lock file is found, 'helm dependency build' will mirror the behavior of 'helm dependency update'.

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for build.

properties.name: Keyring
properties.help: Keyring containing public keys (default "~/.gnupg/pubring.gpg").

properties.name: Verify
properties.help: Verify the packages against signatures.

properties.name: Chart
properties.help: The name of the chart to build.

tasks.help: List all of the dependencies declared in a chart. This can take chart archives and chart directories as input. It will not alter the contents of a chart. This will produce an error if the chart cannot be loaded. It will emit a warning if it cannot find a requirements.yaml.

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for list.

properties.name: Chart
properties.help: The name of the chart to list.

tasks.help: Update the on-disk dependencies to mirror the requirements.yaml file. This command verifies that the required charts, as expressed in 'requirements.yaml', are present in 'charts/' and are at an acceptable version. It will pull down the latest charts that satisfy the dependencies, and clean up old dependencies. On successful update, this will generate a lock file that can be used to rebuild the requirements to an exact version. Dependencies are not required to be represented in 'requirements.yaml'. For that reason, an update command will not remove charts unless they are (a) present in the requirements.yaml file, but (b) at the wrong version.

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for update.

properties.name: Keyring
properties.help: Keyring containing public keys (default "~/.gnupg/pubring.gpg").

properties.name: SkipRefresh
properties.help: Do not refresh the local repository cache.

properties.name: Verify
properties.help: Verify the packages against signatures.

properties.name: Chart
properties.help: The name of the chart to update.

tasks.help: Retrieve a package from a package repository, and download it locally. This is useful for fetching packages to inspect, modify, or repackage. It can also be used to perform cryptographic verification of a chart without installing the chart. There are options for unpacking the chart after download. This will create a directory for the chart and uncompress into that directory. If the --verify flag is specified, the requested chart MUST have a provenance file, and MUST pass the verification process. Failure in any part of this will result in an error, and the chart will not be saved locally.

properties.name: CaFile
properties.help: Verify certificates of HTTPS-enabled servers using this CA bundle.

properties.name: CertFile
properties.help: Identify HTTPS client using this SSL certificate file.

properties.name: Destination
properties.help: Location to write the chart. If this and tardir are specified, tardir is appended to this (default ".").

properties.name: Devel
properties.help: Use development versions, too. Equivalent to version '>0.0.0-0'. If --version is set, this is ignored.

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for fetch.

properties.name: KeyFile
properties.help: Identify HTTPS client using this SSL key file.

properties.name: Keyring
properties.help: Keyring containing public keys (default "~/.gnupg/pubring.gpg").

properties.name: Password
properties.help: Chart repository password.

properties.name: Prov
properties.help: Fetch the provenance file, but don't perform verification.

properties.name: Repo
properties.help: Chart repository url where to locate the requested chart.

properties.name: Untar
properties.help: If set to true, will untar the chart after downloading it.

properties.name: Untardir
properties.help: If untar is specified, this flag specifies the name of the directory into which the chart is expanded (default ".").

properties.name: Username
properties.help: Chart repository username.

properties.name: Verify
properties.help: Verify the package against its signature.

properties.name: Version
properties.help: Specific version of a chart. Without this, the latest version is fetched.

properties.name: Charts
properties.help: The charts to fetch. Can either be specified by <c>repoName/chartName</c> or directly by an url.

tasks.help: This command shows the details of a named release. tasks.help: History prints historical revisions for a given release. A default maximum of 256 revisions will be returned. Setting '--max' configures the maximum length of the revision list returned. The historical release set is printed as a formatted table, e.g:     $ helm history angry-bird --max=4     REVISION   UPDATED                      STATUS           CHART        DESCRIPTION     1           Mon Oct 3 10:15:13 2016     SUPERSEDED      alpine-0.1.0  Initial install     2           Mon Oct 3 10:15:13 2016     SUPERSEDED      alpine-0.1.0  Upgraded successfully     3           Mon Oct 3 10:15:13 2016     SUPERSEDED      alpine-0.1.0  Rolled back to 2     4           Mon Oct 3 10:15:13 2016     DEPLOYED        alpine-0.1.0  Upgraded successfully.

properties.name: ColWidth
properties.help: Specifies the max column width of output (default 60).

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for history.

properties.name: Max
properties.help: Maximum number of revision to include in history (default 256).

properties.name: Output
properties.help: Prints the output in the specified format (json|table|yaml) (default "table").

properties.name: Tls
properties.help: Enable TLS for request.

properties.name: TlsCaCert
properties.help: Path to TLS CA certificate file (default "$HELM_HOME/ca.pem").

properties.name: TlsCert
properties.help: Path to TLS certificate file (default "$HELM_HOME/cert.pem").

properties.name: TlsHostname

properties.name: TlsVerify
properties.help: Enable TLS for request and verify remote.

properties.name: ReleaseName

tasks.help: This command displays the location of HELM_HOME. This is where any helm configuration files live.

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for home.

tasks.help: This command installs Tiller (the Helm server-side component) onto your Kubernetes Cluster and sets up local configuration in $HELM_HOME (default ~/.helm/). As with the rest of the Helm commands, 'helm init' discovers Kubernetes clusters by reading $KUBECONFIG (default '~/.kube/config') and using the default context. To set up just a local environment, use '--client-only'. That will configure $HELM_HOME, but not attempt to connect to a Kubernetes cluster and install the Tiller deployment. When installing Tiller, 'helm init' will attempt to install the latest released version. You can specify an alternative image with '--tiller-image'. For those frequently working on the latest code, the flag '--canary-image' will install the latest pre-release version of Tiller (e.g. the HEAD commit in the GitHub repository on the master branch). To dump a manifest containing the Tiller deployment YAML, combine the '--dry-run' and '--debug' flags.

properties.name: AutomountServiceAccountToken
properties.help: Auto-mount the given service account to tiller (default true).

properties.name: CanaryImage
properties.help: Use the canary Tiller image.

properties.name: ClientOnly
properties.help: If set does not install Tiller.

properties.name: DryRun
properties.help: Do not install local or remote.

properties.name: ForceUpgrade
properties.help: Force upgrade of Tiller to the current helm version.

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for init.

properties.name: HistoryMax
properties.help: Limit the maximum number of revisions saved per release. Use 0 for no limit.

properties.name: LocalRepoUrl
properties.help: URL for local repository (default "http://127.0.0.1:8879/charts").

properties.name: NetHost
properties.help: Install Tiller with net=host.

properties.name: NodeSelectors
properties.help: Labels to specify the node on which Tiller is installed (app=tiller,helm=rocks).

properties.name: Output
properties.help: Skip installation and output Tiller's manifest in specified format (json or yaml).

properties.name: Override
properties.help: Override values for the Tiller Deployment manifest (can specify multiple or separate values with commas: key1=val1,key2=val2).

properties.name: Replicas
properties.help: Amount of tiller instances to run on the cluster (default 1).

properties.name: ServiceAccount
properties.help: Name of service account.

properties.name: SkipRefresh
properties.help: Do not refresh (download) the local repository cache.

properties.name: StableRepoUrl
properties.help: URL for stable repository (default "https://kubernetes-charts.storage.googleapis.com").

properties.name: TillerImage
properties.help: Override Tiller image.

properties.name: TillerTls
properties.help: Install Tiller with TLS enabled.

properties.name: TillerTlsCert
properties.help: Path to TLS certificate file to install with Tiller.

properties.name: TillerTlsHostname
properties.help: The server name used to verify the hostname on the returned certificates from Tiller.

properties.name: TillerTlsKey
properties.help: Path to TLS key file to install with Tiller.

properties.name: TillerTlsVerify
properties.help: Install Tiller with TLS enabled and to verify remote certificates.

properties.name: TlsCaCert
properties.help: Path to CA root certificate.

properties.name: Upgrade
properties.help: Upgrade if Tiller is already installed.

properties.name: Wait
properties.help: Block until Tiller is running and ready to receive requests.

tasks.help: This command installs a chart archive. The install argument must be a chart reference, a path to a packaged chart, a path to an unpacked chart directory or a URL. To override values in a chart, use either the '--values' flag and pass in a file or use the '--set' flag and pass configuration from the command line.  To force string values in '--set', use '--set-string' instead. In case a value is large and therefore you want not to use neither '--values' nor '--set', use '--set-file' to read the single large value from file. 	$ helm install -f myvalues.yaml ./redis or 	$ helm install --set name=prod ./redis or 	$ helm install --set-string long_int=1234567890 ./redis or     $ helm install --set-file multiline_text=path/to/textfile You can specify the '--values'/'-f' flag multiple times. The priority will be given to the last (right-most) file specified. For example, if both myvalues.yaml and override.yaml contained a key called 'Test', the value set in override.yaml would take precedence: 	$ helm install -f myvalues.yaml -f override.yaml ./redis You can specify the '--set' flag multiple times. The priority will be given to the last (right-most) set specified. For example, if both 'bar' and 'newbar' values are set for a key called 'foo', the 'newbar' value would take precedence: 	$ helm install --set foo=bar --set foo=newbar ./redis To check the generated manifests of a release without installing the chart, the '--debug' and '--dry-run' flags can be combined. This will still require a round-trip to the Tiller server. If --verify is set, the chart MUST have a provenance file, and the provenance file MUST pass all verification steps. There are five different ways you can express the chart you want to install: 1. By chart reference: helm install stable/mariadb 2. By path to a packaged chart: helm install ./nginx-1.2.3.tgz 3. By path to an unpacked chart directory: helm install ./nginx 4. By absolute URL: helm install https://example.com/charts/nginx-1.2.3.tgz 5. By chart reference and repo url: helm install --repo https://example.com/charts/ nginx CHART REFERENCES A chart reference is a convenient way of reference a chart in a chart repository. When you use a chart reference with a repo prefix ('stable/mariadb'), Helm will look in the local configuration for a chart repository named 'stable', and will then look for a chart in that repository whose name is 'mariadb'. It will install the latest version of that chart unless you also supply a version number with the '--version' flag. To see the list of chart repositories, use 'helm repo list'. To search for charts in a repository, use 'helm search'.

tasks.help: This command takes a path to a chart and runs a series of tests to verify that the chart is well-formed. If the linter encounters things that will cause the chart to fail installation, it will emit [ERROR] messages. If it encounters issues that break with convention or recommendation, it will emit [WARNING] messages.

properties.name: Set
properties.help: Set values on the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas: key1=val1,key2=val2).

properties.name: SetString
properties.help: Set STRING values on the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas: key1=val1,key2=val2).

properties.name: Strict
properties.help: Fail on lint warnings.

properties.name: Values
properties.help: Specify values in a YAML file (can specify multiple) (default []).

properties.name: Path
properties.help: The Path to a chart.

tasks.help: This command lists all of the releases. By default, it lists only releases that are deployed or failed. Flags like '--deleted' and '--all' will alter this behavior. Such flags can be combined: '--deleted --failed'. By default, items are sorted alphabetically. Use the '-d' flag to sort by release date. If an argument is provided, it will be treated as a filter. Filters are regular expressions (Perl compatible) that are applied to the list of releases. Only items that match the filter will be returned. 	$ helm list 'ara[a-z]+' 	NAME            	UPDATED                 	CHART 	maudlin-arachnid	Mon May  9 16:07:08 2016	alpine-0.1.0 If no results are found, 'helm list' will exit 0, but with no output (or in the case of no '-q' flag, only headers). By default, up to 256 items may be returned. To limit this, use the '--max' flag. Setting '--max' to 0 will not return all results. Rather, it will return the server's default, which may be much higher than 256. Pairing the '--max' flag with the '--offset' flag allows you to page through results.

properties.name: All
properties.help: Show all releases, not just the ones marked DEPLOYED.

properties.name: ChartName
properties.help: Sort by chart name.

properties.name: ColWidth
properties.help: Specifies the max column width of output (default 60).

properties.name: Date
properties.help: Sort by release date.

properties.name: Deleted
properties.help: Show deleted releases.

properties.name: Deleting
properties.help: Show releases that are currently being deleted.

properties.name: Deployed
properties.help: Show deployed releases. If no other is specified, this will be automatically enabled.

properties.name: Failed
properties.help: Show failed releases.

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for list.

properties.name: Max
properties.help: Maximum number of releases to fetch (default 256).

properties.name: Namespace
properties.help: Show releases within a specific namespace.

properties.name: Offset
properties.help: Next release name in the list, used to offset from start value.

properties.name: Output
properties.help: Output the specified format (json or yaml).

properties.name: Pending
properties.help: Show pending releases.

properties.name: Reverse
properties.help: Reverse the sort order.

properties.name: Short
properties.help: Output short (quiet) listing format.

properties.name: Tls
properties.help: Enable TLS for request.

properties.name: TlsCaCert
properties.help: Path to TLS CA certificate file (default "$HELM_HOME/ca.pem").

properties.name: TlsCert
properties.help: Path to TLS certificate file (default "$HELM_HOME/cert.pem").

properties.name: TlsHostname
properties.help: The server name used to verify the hostname on the returned certificates from the server.

properties.name: TlsKey
properties.help: Path to TLS key file (default "$HELM_HOME/key.pem").

properties.name: TlsVerify
properties.help: Enable TLS for request and verify remote.

properties.name: Filter
properties.help: The filter to use.

tasks.help: This command packages a chart into a versioned chart archive file. If a path is given, this will look at that path for a chart (which must contain a Chart.yaml file) and then package that directory. If no path is given, this will look in the present working directory for a Chart.yaml file, and (if found) build the current directory into a chart. Versioned chart archives are used by Helm package repositories.

properties.name: AppVersion
properties.help: Set the appVersion on the chart to this version.

properties.name: DependencyUpdate
properties.help: Update dependencies from "requirements.yaml" to dir "charts/" before packaging.

properties.name: Destination
properties.help: Location to write the chart. (default ".").

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for package.

properties.name: Key
properties.help: Name of the key to use when signing. Used if --sign is true.

properties.name: Keyring
properties.help: Location of a public keyring (default "~/.gnupg/pubring.gpg").

properties.name: Save
properties.help: Save packaged chart to local chart repository (default true).

properties.name: Sign
properties.help: Use a PGP private key to sign this package.

properties.name: Version
properties.help: Set the version on the chart to this semver version.

properties.name: ChartPaths
properties.help: The paths to the charts to package.

tasks.help: This command allows you to install a plugin from a url to a VCS repo or a local path. Example usage:     $ helm plugin install https://github.com/technosophos/helm-template.

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for install.

properties.name: Version
properties.help: Specify a version constraint. If this is not specified, the latest version is installed.

properties.name: Paths

tasks.help: Read the current directory and generate an index file based on the charts found. This tool is used for creating an 'index.yaml' file for a chart repository. To set an absolute URL to the charts, use '--url' flag. To merge the generated index with an existing index file, use the '--merge' flag. In this case, the charts found in the current directory will be merged into the existing index, with local charts taking priority over existing charts.

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for index.

properties.name: Merge
properties.help: Merge the generated index into the given index.

properties.name: Url

properties.name: Directory
properties.help: The directory of the repository.

tasks.help: List chart repositories.

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for list.

tasks.help: Remove a chart repository.

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for remove.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The name of the repository.

tasks.help: Update gets the latest information about charts from the respective chart repositories. Information is cached locally, where it is used by commands like 'helm search'. 'helm update' is the deprecated form of 'helm repo update'. It will be removed in future releases.

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for update.

properties.name: Strict
properties.help: Fail on update warnings.

tasks.help: This command uninstalls Tiller (the Helm server-side component) from your Kubernetes Cluster and optionally deletes local configuration in $HELM_HOME (default ~/.helm/).

properties.name: Force
properties.help: Forces Tiller uninstall even if there are releases installed, or if Tiller is not in ready state. Releases are not deleted.).

properties.name: Help

properties.name: RemoveHelmHome

properties.help: Enable TLS for request.

tasks.help: This command rolls back a release to a previous revision. The first argument of the rollback command is the name of a release, and the second is a revision (version) number. To see revision numbers, run 'helm history RELEASE'. If you'd like to rollback to the previous release use 'helm rollback [RELEASE] 0'.

properties.name: Description
properties.help: Specify a description for the release.

properties.name: DryRun
properties.help: Simulate a rollback.

properties.name: Force
properties.help: Force resource update through delete/recreate if needed.

properties.name: NoHooks
properties.help: Prevent hooks from running during rollback.

properties.name: RecreatePods
properties.help: Performs pods restart for the resource if applicable.

properties.name: Timeout
properties.help: Time in seconds to wait for any individual Kubernetes operation (like Jobs for hooks) (default 300).

properties.name: Tls
properties.help: Enable TLS for request.

properties.name: TlsCaCert
properties.help: Path to TLS CA certificate file (default "$HELM_HOME/ca.pem").

properties.name: TlsCert

properties.name: TlsHostname
properties.help: The server name used to verify the hostname on the returned certificates from the server.

properties.help: If set, will wait until all Pods, PVCs, Services, and minimum number of Pods of a Deployment are in a ready state before marking the release as successful. It will wait for as long as --timeout.

tasks.help: Search reads through all of the repositories configured on the system, and looks for matches. Repositories are managed with 'helm repo' commands.

properties.name: ColWidth
properties.help: Specifies the max column width of output (default 60).

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for search.

properties.name: Regexp
properties.help: Use regular expressions for searching.

properties.name: Version
properties.help: Search using semantic versioning constraints.

properties.name: Versions
properties.help: Show the long listing, with each version of each chart on its own line.

properties.name: Keyword
properties.help: The keyword to search for.

tasks.help: This command starts a local chart repository server that serves charts from a local directory. The new server will provide HTTP access to a repository. By default, it will scan all of the charts in '$HELM_HOME/repository/local' and serve those over the local IPv4 TCP port (default '127.0.0.1:8879'). This command is intended to be used for educational and testing purposes only. It is best to rely on a dedicated web server or a cloud-hosted solution like Google Cloud Storage for production use. See https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/master/docs/chart_repository.md#hosting-chart-repositories for more information on hosting chart repositories in a production setting.

properties.name: Address
properties.help: Address to listen on (default "127.0.0.1:8879").

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for serve.

properties.name: RepoPath
properties.help: Local directory path from which to serve charts.

properties.name: Url
properties.help: External URL of chart repository.

tasks.help: This command shows the status of a named release. The status consists of: - last deployment time - k8s namespace in which the release lives - state of the release (can be: UNKNOWN, DEPLOYED, DELETED, SUPERSEDED, FAILED or DELETING) - list of resources that this release consists of, sorted by kind - details on last test suite run, if applicable - additional notes provided by the chart.

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for status.

properties.name: Output
properties.help: Output the status in the specified format (json or yaml).

properties.name: Revision
properties.help: If set, display the status of the named release with revision.

properties.name: Tls
properties.help: Enable TLS for request.

properties.name: TlsCaCert
properties.help: Path to TLS CA certificate file (default "$HELM_HOME/ca.pem").

properties.name: TlsCert
properties.help: Path to TLS certificate file (default "$HELM_HOME/cert.pem").

properties.name: TlsHostname
properties.help: The server name used to verify the hostname on the returned certificates from the server.

properties.name: TlsKey
properties.help: Path to TLS key file (default "$HELM_HOME/key.pem").

properties.name: TlsVerify
properties.help: Enable TLS for request and verify remote.

properties.name: ReleaseName
properties.help: The name of the release to get the status for.

tasks.help: Render chart templates locally and display the output. This does not require Tiller. However, any values that would normally be looked up or retrieved in-cluster will be faked locally. Additionally, none of the server-side testing of chart validity (e.g. whether an API is supported) is done. To render just one template in a chart, use '-x': 	$ helm template mychart -x templates/deployment.yaml.

properties.name: Execute
properties.help: Only execute the given templates.

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for template.

properties.name: IsUpgrade
properties.help: Set .Release.IsUpgrade instead of .Release.IsInstall.

properties.name: KubeVersion
properties.help: Kubernetes version used as Capabilities.KubeVersion.Major/Minor (default "1.9").

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Release name (default "release-name").

properties.name: NameTemplate
properties.help: Specify template used to name the release.

properties.name: Namespace
properties.help: Namespace to install the release into.

properties.name: Notes
properties.help: Show the computed NOTES.txt file as well.

properties.name: OutputDir
properties.help: Writes the executed templates to files in output-dir instead of stdout.

properties.name: Set
properties.help: Set values on the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas: key1=val1,key2=val2).

properties.name: SetFile
properties.help: Set values from respective files specified via the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas: key1=path1,key2=path2).

properties.name: SetString
properties.help: Set STRING values on the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas: key1=val1,key2=val2).

properties.name: Values
properties.help: Specify values in a YAML file (can specify multiple) (default []).

tasks.help: The test command runs the tests for a release. The argument this command takes is the name of a deployed release. The tests to be run are defined in the chart that was installed.

properties.name: Cleanup

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for test.

properties.name: Parallel
properties.help: Run test pods in parallel.

properties.name: Timeout
properties.help: Time in seconds to wait for any individual Kubernetes operation (like Jobs for hooks) (default 300).

properties.name: Tls

properties.name: TlsCaCert
properties.help: Path to TLS CA certificate file (default "$HELM_HOME/ca.pem").

properties.name: TlsCert
properties.help: Path to TLS certificate file (default "$HELM_HOME/cert.pem").

tasks.help: This command upgrades a release to a specified version of a chart and/or updates chart values. Required arguments are release and chart. The chart argument can be one of:  - a chart reference('stable/mariadb'); use '--version' and '--devel' flags for versions other than latest,  - a path to a chart directory,  - a packaged chart,  - a fully qualified URL. To customize the chart values, use any of  - '--values'/'-f' to pass in a yaml file holding settings,  - '--set' to provide one or more key=val pairs directly,  - '--set-string' to provide key=val forcing val to be stored as a string,  - '--set-file' to provide key=path to read a single large value from a file at path. To edit or append to the existing customized values, add the  '--reuse-values' flag, otherwise any existing customized values are ignored. If no chart value arguments are provided on the command line, any existing customized values are carried forward. If you want to revert to just the values provided in the chart, use the '--reset-values' flag. You can specify any of the chart value flags multiple times. The priority will be given to the last (right-most) value specified. For example, if both myvalues.yaml and override.yaml contained a key called 'Test', the value set in override.yaml would take precedence: 	$ helm upgrade -f myvalues.yaml -f override.yaml redis ./redis Note that the key name provided to the '--set', '--set-string' and '--set-file' flags can reference structure elements. Examples:   - mybool=TRUE   - livenessProbe.timeoutSeconds=10   - metrics.annotations[0]=hey,metrics.annotations[1]=ho which sets the top level key mybool to true, the nested timeoutSeconds to 10, and two array values, respectively. Note that the value side of the key=val provided to '--set' and '--set-string' flags will pass through shell evaluation followed by yaml type parsing to produce the final value. This may alter inputs with special characters in unexpected ways, for example 	$ helm upgrade --set pwd=3jk$o2,z=f\30.e redis ./redis results in "pwd: 3jk" and "z: f30.e". Use single quotes to avoid shell evaluation and argument delimiters, and use backslash to escape yaml special characters: 	$ helm upgrade --set pwd='3jk$o2z=f\\30.e' redis ./redis which results in the expected "pwd: 3jk$o2z=f\30.e". If a single quote occurs in your value then follow your shell convention for escaping it; for example in bash: 	$ helm upgrade --set pwd='3jk$o2z=f\\30with'\''quote' which results in "pwd: 3jk$o2z=f\30with'quote".

properties.name: Atomic
properties.help: If set, upgrade process rolls back changes made in case of failed upgrade, also sets --wait flag.

properties.name: CaFile
properties.help: Verify certificates of HTTPS-enabled servers using this CA bundle.

properties.name: CertFile
properties.help: Identify HTTPS client using this SSL certificate file.

properties.name: Description
properties.help: Specify the description to use for the upgrade, rather than the default.

properties.name: Devel
properties.help: Use development versions, too. Equivalent to version '>0.0.0-0'. If --version is set, this is ignored.

properties.name: DryRun
properties.help: Simulate an upgrade.

properties.name: Force
properties.help: Force resource update through delete/recreate if needed.

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for upgrade.

properties.name: Install
properties.help: If a release by this name doesn't already exist, run an install.

properties.name: CreateNamespace
properties.help: If --install is set, create the release namespace if not present.

properties.name: KeyFile
properties.help: Identify HTTPS client using this SSL key file.

properties.name: Keyring
properties.help: Path to the keyring that contains public signing keys (default "~/.gnupg/pubring.gpg").

properties.name: Namespace
properties.help: Namespace to install the release into (only used if --install is set). Defaults to the current kube config namespace.

properties.name: NoHooks
properties.help: Disable pre/post upgrade hooks.

properties.name: Password
properties.help: Chart repository password where to locate the requested chart.

properties.name: RecreatePods
properties.help: Performs pods restart for the resource if applicable.

properties.name: RenderSubchartNotes
properties.help: Render subchart notes along with parent.

properties.name: Repo
properties.help: Chart repository url where to locate the requested chart.

properties.name: ResetValues
properties.help: When upgrading, reset the values to the ones built into the chart.

properties.name: ReuseValues
properties.help: When upgrading, reuse the last release's values and merge in any overrides from the command line via --set and -f. If '--reset-values' is specified, this is ignored.

properties.name: Set
properties.help: Set values on the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas: key1=val1,key2=val2).

properties.name: SetFile
properties.help: Set values from respective files specified via the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas: key1=path1,key2=path2).

properties.name: SetString
properties.help: Set STRING values on the command line (can specify multiple or separate values with commas: key1=val1,key2=val2).

properties.name: Timeout
properties.help: Time in seconds to wait for any individual Kubernetes operation (like Jobs for hooks) (default 300).

properties.name: Tls
properties.help: Enable TLS for request.

properties.name: TlsCaCert
properties.help: Path to TLS CA certificate file (default "$HELM_HOME/ca.pem").

properties.name: TlsCert

properties.name: TlsKey

properties.name: TlsVerify

properties.name: Username

properties.name: Values
properties.help: Specify values in a YAML file or a URL(can specify multiple) (default []).

properties.name: Verify
properties.help: Verify the provenance of the chart before upgrading.

properties.name: Version
properties.help: Specify the exact chart version to use. If this is not specified, the latest version is used.

properties.name: Wait
properties.help: If set, will wait until all Pods, PVCs, Services, and minimum number of Pods of a Deployment are in a ready state before marking the release as successful. It will wait for as long as --timeout.

properties.name: Release

properties.name: Chart

tasks.help: Verify that the given chart has a valid provenance file. Provenance files provide crytographic verification that a chart has not been tampered with, and was packaged by a trusted provider. This command can be used to verify a local chart. Several other commands provide '--verify' flags that run the same validation. To generate a signed package, use the 'helm package --sign' command.

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for verify.

properties.name: Keyring
properties.help: Keyring containing public keys (default "~/.gnupg/pubring.gpg").

properties.name: Path
properties.help: The path to the chart to verify.

tasks.help: Show the client and server versions for Helm and tiller. This will print a representation of the client and server versions of Helm and Tiller. The output will look something like this: Client: &version.Version{SemVer:"v2.0.0", GitCommit:"ff52399e51bb880526e9cd0ed8386f6433b74da1", GitTreeState:"clean"} Server: &version.Version{SemVer:"v2.0.0", GitCommit:"b0c113dfb9f612a9add796549da66c0d294508a3", GitTreeState:"clean"} - SemVer is the semantic version of the release. - GitCommit is the SHA for the commit that this version was built from. - GitTreeState is "clean" if there are no local code changes when this binary was   built, and "dirty" if the binary was built from locally modified code. To print just the client version, use '--client'. To print just the server version, use '--server'.

properties.name: Client
properties.help: Client version only.

properties.name: Help
properties.help: Help for version.

properties.name: Server
properties.help: Server version only.

properties.name: Short
properties.help: Print the version number.

properties.name: Template
properties.help: Template for version string format.

properties.name: Tls
properties.help: Enable TLS for request.

properties.name: TlsCaCert
properties.help: Path to TLS CA certificate file (default "$HELM_HOME/ca.pem").

properties.name: TlsCert
properties.help: Path to TLS certificate file (default "$HELM_HOME/cert.pem").

properties.name: TlsHostname

properties.name: TlsKey

properties.name: TlsVerify
properties.help: Enable TLS for request and verify remote.

properties.name: Home

properties.name: Host

properties.name: KubeContext
